Art. 4.38. 
Inheritance option after expiry of the time limits granted 
The successor nevertheless retains, after expiry of the time limits granted by Article 4.37, ¤ 2, and even those granted by the court in accordance with Article 4.37, ¤ 3, the right to make a further inventory and exercise his inheritance option, unless he has already acted as an heir, or if there is a judgment against him which has the force of res judicata and which condemns him as an outright heir.
If the successor renounces when the time limits have expired or before, the costs legitimately incurred by him up to that time shall be borne by the succession.
